text: As the year draws to a close, the holiday season is upon us once again. Although we still have two months until Christmas, studies have shown decorating early is actually good for your mood. The vibrant colors and twinkling lights simply trigger the release feel-good dopamine, which in turn, boosts happiness and energy. I must admit, Christmas decor makes me grin like a kid with ice-cream, until I look at the price tag of tinsel and garlands and baubles. Yikes! Being the frugal person that I am, shelling out big bucks for seasonal decor is just not viable. So, every year, I repurpose my decor from previous years and throw in a few new elements to freshen the look. This year, I’m excited to share 14 tried-and-true IKEA Christmas decor ideas that will help make your home festive and stylish with just a pretty penny. 14 Christmas Decor Ideas With IKEA 1. Transform Lanterns with Seasonal Inserts Source: thegirlcreative.com Lanterns are versatile and perfect for seasonal decor. Grab a few IKEA BORRBY lanterns and fill them with different seasonal items. For fall, use pinecones and miniature pumpkins. For winter, try faux snow and small ornaments. It’s an easy and affordable way to change up your decor every season. When holidays are over, your can reuse them as usual. 2. Create a Festive Wreath with Faux Greenery Wreaths aren’t just for Christmas. The purist will possibly frown on me but I use my wreath for every festivity, even Chinese New Year with plum blossoms and origami cranes woven into the greens. Get a basic wreath like the IKEA SMYCKA and add in artificial flowers and greenery to create your one-of-a-kind wreath. Mix in seasonal elements like berries for fall or ornaments for winter. Hang it on your door, above your fireplace, or even as a centerpiece. 3. Personalize Your Pillow Covers @sarahepope30 ~DIY Christmas tree pillow~ ???? HOW CUTE. This is extremely affordable to do, and perfect for a craft night out with the girls! I got my pillow case off shein for dirt cheap and the quality is great, then all you need is some yarn and hot glue! It’s as easy as that! See how it’s done in this reel. 10. Update Your Wall Art Swap out your wall art with seasonal prints. IKEA’s RIBBA frames are perfect for this. DIY Wrapping Paper Photo Credit: Poppytalk.com Create unique gift wrap effortlessly using cookie cutters, MÅLA paint, and a MÅLA drawing paper roll. Use the KUSTFYR cookie cutters for Halloween and the VINTERFINT pastry cutter for Christmas. All you need to do is dip the cookie cutter in the paint and stamp onto paper. This fun project is a great way to involve your kids, and they’ll enjoy lending a hand. 12. Decorate with Scent AVMÅLA scented candle in glass jar | Photo Credit: IKEA.com IKEA’s scented candles come in a variety of seasonal scents. Place them around your bathroom to create a relaxing, festive atmosphere. Think cinnamon and apple for fall like the HOSTAGILLE, or pine and peppermint for winter like the AVMÅLA. 13. Seasonal Planters Transform basic IKEA planters with a touch of seasonal charm. Paint terracotta pots with autumn colors or wrap them with burlap for a rustic look. In winter, fill them with evergreen branches and fairy lights for a magical touch. 14. Elevate Your Outdoor Space Don’t forget about your outdoor areas — your porch, balcony, or garden can be equally festive. Create a cozy outdoor seating area using IKEA KRINGSYNT lanterns or string lights to enhance the ambiance. Add a terracotta pot heater, waterproof cushions, and throws to create a comfortable space to enjoy a hot drink during the cooler months. Taking it Up a Notch Repurpose Items: Use items you already have in new ways. For example, a summer vase can hold autumn leaves or winter branches. Shop Off-Season: Buy seasonal decor at the end of the season for the best deals. Stock up on items you know you’ll use next year. Mix High and Low: Combine IKEA finds with a few splurge items. This creates a balanced, curated look without going over budget. DIY It: Don’t be afraid to get crafty. Many seasonal decor items can be made at home with basic supplies from IKEA and the craft store. What’s your favorite holiday decor from IKEA? Let us know in the comments. Or, do you have a festive IKEA hack? Share it with us and you may be featured next.

As the year draws to a close, the holiday season is upon us once again. Although we still have two months until Christmas, studies have shown decorating early is actually good for your mood. The vibrant colors and twinkling lights simply trigger the release feel-good dopamine, which in turn, boosts happiness and energy.

I must admit, Christmas decor makes me grin like a kid with ice-cream, until I look at the price tag of tinsel and garlands and baubles. Yikes! Being the frugal person that I am, shelling out big bucks for seasonal decor is just not viable.

So, every year, I repurpose my decor from previous years and throw in a few new elements to freshen the look. This year, I’m excited to share 14 tried-and-true IKEA Christmas decor ideas that will help make your home festive and stylish with just a pretty penny.

14 Christmas Decor Ideas With IKEA

1. Transform Lanterns with Seasonal Inserts

Lanterns are versatile and perfect for seasonal decor. Grab a few IKEA BORRBY lanterns and fill them with different seasonal items. For fall, use pinecones and miniature pumpkins. For winter, try faux snow and small ornaments. It’s an easy and affordable way to change up your decor every season. When holidays are over, your can reuse them as usual.

2. Create a Festive Wreath with Faux Greenery

Wreaths aren’t just for Christmas. The purist will possibly frown on me but I use my wreath for every festivity, even Chinese New Year with plum blossoms and origami cranes woven into the greens. Get a basic wreath like the IKEA SMYCKA and add in artificial flowers and greenery to create your one-of-a-kind wreath. Mix in seasonal elements like berries for fall or ornaments for winter. Hang it on your door, above your fireplace, or even as a centerpiece.

String lights add a magical touch to any season. Drape IKEA SVARTRÅ lights around your living room, bedroom, or outdoor space. For a fall vibe, weave them through autumnal garlands. For winter, mix them with greenery and ornaments, and festive decor.

6. Create a Seasonal Display with Shelves

Use IKEA picture ledges or floating shelves like LACK or BERGSHULT to create a rotating seasonal display. Change out decor items like small plants, frames, and figurines to match the season. It’s an easy way to keep your decor fresh and festive all year round. Better yet, for the Christmas season, create a hot cocoa and cookie bar for the one bringing the presents.

7. Dress Up Your Curtains

Add a touch of seasonal charm to your windows by dressing up your curtains. Use IKEA RITVA curtains and add seasonal tiebacks or curtain clips. Think acorn and leaf clips for fall, or snowflake and star clips for winter.

8. DIY Advent Calendar

For a fun winter project, create a DIY advent calendar using rolls of corrugated cardboard tubes and the IKEA KOMPLEMENT multi-hanger. Fill each roll with small treats or notes. Slot them into the rings for a festive countdown to the holidays.

9. Craft a Mantel Scape

IKEA glass vases and bowls like the IKEA 365+ are perfect for creating seasonal centerpieces. Fill their iconic glass and gold BEGÅVNING domes with seasonal items like pumpkins and gourds for fall, or ornaments and pinecones for winter. Place them on your fireplace mantel or coffee table for an instant festive touch. If you can’t find the right display tray, you can easily DIY your own with IKEA bowls and plates. See how it’s done in this reel.

10. Update Your Wall Art

Swap out your wall art with seasonal prints. IKEA’s RIBBA frames are perfect for this. Choose artwork or photos that represent the season, and switch them out as the seasons change. If prints aren’t festive enough for you, level up with 3D vignettes in IKEA shadowbox frames.

11. DIY Wrapping Paper

Create unique gift wrap effortlessly using cookie cutters, MÅLA paint, and a MÅLA drawing paper roll. Use the KUSTFYR cookie cutters for Halloween and the VINTERFINT pastry cutter for Christmas. All you need to do is dip the cookie cutter in the paint and stamp onto paper. This fun project is a great way to involve your kids, and they’ll enjoy lending a hand.

12. Decorate with Scent

IKEA’s scented candles come in a variety of seasonal scents. Place them around your bathroom to create a relaxing, festive atmosphere. Think cinnamon and apple for fall like the HOSTAGILLE, or pine and peppermint for winter like the AVMÅLA.

13. Seasonal Planters

Transform basic IKEA planters with a touch of seasonal charm. Paint terracotta pots with autumn colors or wrap them with burlap for a rustic look. In winter, fill them with evergreen branches and fairy lights for a magical touch.

14. Elevate Your Outdoor Space

Don’t forget about your outdoor areas — your porch, balcony, or garden can be equally festive. Create a cozy outdoor seating area using IKEA KRINGSYNT lanterns or string lights to enhance the ambiance. Add a terracotta pot heater, waterproof cushions, and throws to create a comfortable space to enjoy a hot drink during the cooler months.

Taking it Up a Notch

  1. Repurpose Items: Use items you already have in new ways. For example, a summer vase can hold autumn leaves or winter branches.
  2. Shop Off-Season: Buy seasonal decor at the end of the season for the best deals. Stock up on items you know you’ll use next year.
  3. Mix High and Low: Combine IKEA finds with a few splurge items. This creates a balanced, curated look without going over budget.
  4. DIY It: Don’t be afraid to get crafty. Many seasonal decor items can be made at home with basic supplies from IKEA and the craft store.

What’s your favorite holiday decor from IKEA? Let us know in the comments.

Or, do you have a festive IKEA hack? Share it with us and you may be featured next.
